items.prompt: If you buy this ___, your home is protected.
items.explanation: Una 'policy' es el contrato o póliza de seguro.

items.prompt: If I ___ the premium, I will have coverage.
items.explanation: Primer condicional: If + presente simple.

items.prompt: The insurance company will pay if you make a ___.
items.explanation: Un 'claim' es una reclamación o siniestro para solicitar un pago.

items.prompt: If she loses her job, the insurance ___ help her.
items.explanation: Primer condicional: ..., will + verbo.

items.prompt: What is 'coverage'?
options: The amount of protection in a policy
items.explanation: La 'coverage' es la cobertura o cantidad de protección del seguro.

items.prompt: The monthly ___ is 50 euros.
items.explanation: La 'premium' es la prima, el pago regular del seguro.

items.prompt: If we ___ travel insurance, we will be safe on our trip.
items.explanation: Estructura de condición: If + presente simple.

items.prompt: What happens if I ___ my phone?
items.explanation: En la cláusula con 'if' usamos presente simple.

items.prompt: The company ___ pay your claim if you don't have a receipt.
items.explanation: 'Won't' es la contracción de 'will not', usada para consecuencias negativas.

items.prompt: ___ insurance is important for your family if you die.
items.explanation: 'Life insurance' es el seguro de vida.

items.prompt: If you have a car accident, you should call your ___ agent.
items.explanation: Debes llamar a tu agente de seguros (insurance agent).

items.prompt: Your ___ will increase if you have many accidents.
items.explanation: La prima (premium) suele subir si hay muchos siniestros.

items.prompt: If they ___ the contract, they will have full coverage.
items.explanation: If + presente simple.

items.prompt: Will the insurance ___ the theft?
items.explanation: Después de 'will' usamos el verbo en infinitivo sin 'to'.

items.prompt: If it ___ tomorrow, my home insurance will cover the damage.
items.explanation: Tercera persona del singular en presente simple: 'floods'.

items.prompt: What is a 'policy'?
items.explanation: Una 'policy' es el documento contractual del seguro.

items.prompt: If I ___ sick, I will go to the hospital.
items.explanation: If + presente simple del verbo 'to be' (I am).

items.prompt: They ___ buy car insurance if they get a new car.
items.explanation: Consecuencia futura en el primer condicional.

items.prompt: Is your ___ high or low?
items.explanation: Se refiere al coste de la cuota del seguro.

items.prompt: If you ___ any questions, the agent will answer them.
items.explanation: If + presente simple.

items.prompt: What ___ happen if I don't pay?
items.explanation: Pregunta sobre la consecuencia futura.

items.prompt: The ___ does not cover natural disasters.
items.explanation: La póliza (policy) especifica qué está cubierto y qué no.

items.prompt: If the car is stolen, we ___ make a claim.
items.explanation: Acción futura resultante de una condición.

items.prompt: How much ___ is included in this plan?

items.prompt: If you ___ older, your life insurance will be more expensive.
items.explanation: If + presente simple.

items.prompt: We ___ sign the policy today.
items.explanation: Decisión futura.

items.prompt: My ___ was rejected by the company.
items.explanation: Una reclamación (claim) puede ser rechazada si no cumple las condiciones.

items.prompt: If you ___ the terms, you will be happy.
items.explanation: If + presente simple.

items.prompt: The agent ___ call you back later.
items.explanation: Promesa o acción futura.

items.prompt: Do you have ___ insurance?
items.explanation: 'Health insurance' es el seguro médico.

items.prompt: If you ___ careful, you will not have an accident.
items.explanation: If + presente simple (you are).

items.prompt: The insurance will pay if the damage ___ serious.
items.explanation: La condición va en presente simple.

items.prompt: I ___ pay my premium next week.
items.explanation: Intención futura.

items.prompt: What ___ I do if there is a fire?
items.explanation: Pregunta sobre una acción futura.

items.prompt: Home insurance ___ you if your house is damaged.
items.explanation: Hecho general expresado en presente simple.

items.prompt: If you ___ to the USA, you will need health insurance.
items.explanation: If + presente simple.

items.prompt: Who ___ pay for the repairs?
items.explanation: Pregunta sobre quién asumirá el coste en el futuro.

items.prompt: I need to renew my ___.
items.explanation: Se renueva la póliza (policy).

items.prompt: If she ___ the rules, she will be fine.
items.explanation: If + presente simple (3ª persona).

items.prompt: The company ___ notify you by mail.
items.explanation: Comunicación de una acción futura.

items.prompt: Is this ___ enough for my needs?
items.explanation: Pregunta sobre si el nivel de protección es suficiente.

items.prompt: If you ___ your premium, you will lose your coverage.
items.explanation: Negación en presente simple: 'don't pay'.

items.prompt: The insurance ___ not pay for intentional damage.
items.explanation: Consecuencia o regla futura.

items.prompt: Can I make a ___ online?
items.explanation: Pregunta sobre la posibilidad de tramitar un siniestro.

items.prompt: If they ___ a discount, I will buy it.
items.explanation: If + presente simple.

items.prompt: The contract ___ expire next month.
items.explanation: Suceso futuro inevitable.

items.prompt: What's the ___ for this car insurance?
items.explanation: Pregunta por el precio de la cuota.

items.prompt: If you ___ the police, the insurance will ask for the report.
items.explanation: If + presente simple.

items.prompt: They ___ send the money in two weeks.
items.explanation: Promesa de pago en el futuro.

items.prompt: Is the ___ comprehensive?
items.explanation: 'Comprehensive' es un tipo de cobertura a todo riesgo.

items.prompt: If you sign the contract, you ___ receive a copy of the policy.
items.explanation: En el primer condicional, la consecuencia usa 'will'.

items.prompt: If she ___ (pay) the premium today, she will be covered.
items.explanation: Usamos presente simple en la condición (3ª persona).

items.prompt: Your car insurance will cover the damage if you ___ an accident.
items.explanation: La condición se expresa en presente simple.

items.prompt: Match the insurance terms with their definitions:

items.prompt: If the storm ___ the roof, the insurance will pay.

items.prompt: I ___ call the insurance company if I find a problem.
items.explanation: Consecuencia futura con 'will'.

items.prompt: What does 'premium' mean in Spanish?

items.prompt: If it rains, ___ the policy cover water damage?

items.prompt: We will be safe if we ___ a good insurance plan.

items.explanation: Relación entre el precio y el nivel de protección.

items.prompt: A ___ is a person whose job is to sell insurance.

items.prompt: If you want to save money, you ___ (need) to compare policies.
items.explanation: Consecuencia lógica en presente (o futuro, pero 'need' es común).

items.explanation: Diferentes tipos de protección según la necesidad.

items.prompt: If you ___ the contract today, it will start tomorrow.
items.explanation: If + presente simple.

items.prompt: I think the prices ___ go up next year.
items.explanation: Predicción futura.

items.prompt: If I ___ (be) you, I will buy the life insurance.
